tags: im not counting sandor in this because thats a whole other thing....
i genuinely cant say how much help he would have been if sansa had left with him
summary: one very interesting thing about sansa’s story imo, whether we’re talking book or show is the total subversion of the damsel in...
body:
one very interesting thing about sansa’s story imo, whether we’re talking book or show is the total subversion of the damsel in distress trope. sansa is your typical feminine princess, being held hostage by the enemy and abused. (a “little bird” trapped in a cage.) in your common fairytale she would be rescued by a knight or prince. but no one ever comes to rescue sansa. no one even tries to rescue her.

ONE person tries to rescue her. her brother robb. and he dies. no one after robb ever makes an attempt. sansa literally has to save HERSELF. if sansa didn’t take initiative she would still be trapped in king’s landing. sansa dreamt of heroes, of knights and princes and a daring rescue. but in the end she became her own hero.

summary: Sansa x Petyr, Liberal Arts AU  -I sometimes feel like I’m looking down on myself. Like there’s this older, wiser me watching...
caption:
Sansa x Petyr, Liberal Arts AU

 -I sometimes feel like I’m looking down on myself. Like there’s this older, wiser me watching over this 19-year-old rough draft, who’s full of all this potential, but has to live more to catch up with that other self somehow. And, uh, I know I’ll get there. It’s just sometimes I think I want to rush the process, you know? And I don’t know, maybe, um - maybe I thought you were some sort of shortcut. Does that make any sense?
-If I wrote you, I would be like, “This is the best rough draft ever.“  ©

title: Maine Attraction

by MaxBetta

Sansa Stark is walking her dog near her log cabin in rural Maine when she happens upon a large stranger passed out in the snow. She takes him in, in more ways than one.

Words: 1692, Chapters: ½, Language: English

summary: what are some examples of irony in asoiaf ?
question: what are some examples of irony in asoiaf ?
answer:
There are many :

- Cersei wanted to marry the king and she did though not the one she wanted but another who killed her beloved Rhaegar 

- Cersei wants the iron throne and it will eventually kill her

- Sansa wanted to marry Joffrey : 

 I love him, Father, I truly truly do, I love him as much as Queen Naerys loved Prince Aemon the Dragonknight

Her “bastard brother” Jon is prince Aemon, the heir to the throne and he will be loved by queen Daenerys

- Catelyn didn’t approve Arya and was cold towards Jon while hoping Sansa would be a queen but it’s Arya who will eventually marry the king and Jon, a despised bastard is the true prince

- Ned kept Jon’s parentage and Lyanna’s and Rhaegar’s marriage a secret but he died because he wanted to reveal the secret of Joffrey’s parentage and Cersei’s and Jaime’s relationship

- Tywin hated Tyrion, the disfigured child but it’s Tyrion who has his father’s brain for diplomacy and tactics

- Robert’s last wish was for his spoiled son, Joffrey, to be a better man than he was while his true son, Gendry, spent his childhood in poverty and is definitely a better man than Robert

- the most important character, Rhaegar, dies before the story begins

- the true identity of two most important living characters remains unknown

And many many more ;)

Thank you for the ask :)

tags: good king jon and good queen sansa
summary: “Joffrey never let anyone question his authority. You think he was a good king?”…“Do you think I’m Joffrey?”…“You’re as far from...
caption:
“Joffrey never let anyone question his authority. You think he was a good king?”…“Do you think I’m Joffrey?”…“You’re as far from Joffrey as anyone I’ve ever met.”
“You’re good at this, you know.”…“At what?”…“At ruling.”

- Sansa Stark (Game of Thrones, S07E01)

She’s good at this, he thought, as he watched her tell Lord Gyles that his cough was sounding better, compliment Elinor Tyrell on her gown, and question Jalabhar Xho about wedding customs in Summer Isles […]
She would have made Joffrey a good queen and a better wife if he’d had the sense to love her. 

- Tyrion Lannister (A Storm of Swords)

tags: yes it's another ridiculously indulgent soft sugar daddy fic from yours truly
summary: [In which scholarship student Sansa Stark accidentally acquires a sugar daddy.] “I can understand you might not be looking for a...
caption:
[In which scholarship student Sansa Stark accidentally acquires a sugar daddy.]

“I can understand you might not be looking for a serious relationship during university, but no romance, for a lovely girl like you,” he tsk’s and looks genuinely sorrowful, “such a shame, darling,” he says and places a warm hand over hers.

At the touch, at his gaze, she feels a flush creep up her neck and wants to squirm in her seat. There’s something about him, about his attention to her, that makes her feel warm, wanted.

It’s just that he’s sort of fatherly, she reasons when she talks to Margaery about it - Margaery who was intrigued the first time she found out about the fortnightly coffees, and that Petyr always paid.

- The finer things by framboise

blog.name: too-much-jonerys
blog.title: Jonerys Side Blog
blog.description:
Main Blog: lareinadecorazones.tumblr.com

Ao3: ReinaWritesStuff

CURRENTLY A GAME OF THRONES SEASON 8 NEGATIVITY BLOG. This is my Jonerys side blog, so my shipping fuckery doesn't disrupt my non-shipper/GoT followers because Jonerys is my life force now. I want to post and reblog in peace. NOTE: This blog is Gendarya, Team Dragonstone-friendly. This blog is NOT J*nsa-friendly or supportive of Jon or Dany's past romantic pairings. I don't actively hate on them on here in public. But, I will not post anything about them either.

summary:
Howling ghosts they reappear 
In mountains that are stacked with fear.
But, you're a king, and I'm a lionheart.
****
And, as the...
body:
Howling ghosts they reappear

In mountains that are stacked with fear.

But, you’re a king, and I’m a lionheart.

****

And, as the world comes to an end,

I’ll be here to hold your hand.

Cause you’re my king, and I’m your lionheart.

“King and Lionheart”- Of Monsters and Men


Have this shitty edit to commemorate the siblings bond that D&D can pry from my cold, dead fingers. In this house, the Starklings love and support each other and this song is them.

Cause you’re my king, and I’m your lionheart.

Have this shitty edit to commemorate the siblings bond that D&D can pry from my cold, dead fingers. In this house, the Starklings love and support each other and this song is them.

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

tags: I'm honest there is still nothing better than Jon and Sansa hug from season 6
even Sansa hugs with Bran and Arya are not so perfect
we will see what will happen in season 8
but it will be very difficult to do better than that
summary: Wow, this video is so incredible. You’ll see that the first times the song said  “Hello, welcome home” the creator used the...
caption:
Wow, this video is so incredible.

You’ll see that the first times the song said  “Hello, welcome home” the creator used the first hug from season 6 ( and I want to scream how perfect it is) but then, in the end, she used the new hug from season 8… AMAZING.

Just watch it, trust me ( and give credit to the creator here)

blog.title: Church the Cat, Our Lord and Savior
blog.description: Call me Vi, multi fandom with political stuff and cute animals, shouldn’t take long to figure out my ships, honestly just very tired over here, please be nice

summary:
Hi 👋 @hola-pepe You must be new here. 
Here’s the breakdown of the succession of Winterfell/Kingdom of the North as dictated by...
body:
Hi 👋 @hola-pepe You must be new here.

Here’s the breakdown of the succession of Winterfell/Kingdom of the North as dictated by male primogeniture starting with the last two really definitely nobody doubts it lords:

-Ned Stark (dead)

-Robb Stark (dead)

-Bran Stark (declared dead but he’s fine he’s off getting high with Jon’s uncle)

-Rickon Stark (declared dead but he’s fine he’s off fighting unicorns)

-Benjen Stark (presumed dead, disinterested)

-Sansa Stark

-Arya Stark (presumed dead)

-Jon Snow (disinterested, illegitimate)

Note: Benjen might be after Jon or before the girls depending on the precise rules but he’s mostly dead so it’s irrelevant.

So as far as pretty much all of Westeros is concerned, Sansa is the legal heir of Winterfell and maybe also the North at the time of the Purple Wedding.

However, there are two curve balls thrown in by Robb and LF here.

1. Robb disowned Sansa and declared Jon his heir after Starks & Co. heard about Sansa’s marriage to Tyrion.

Literally the only people who know about this are Robb’s inner circle so it’s not THAT important but also important in the long run because two of the people who do know and are alive and not zombies are at Greywater Watch so they’re definitely alive and can tell people eventually. However, since Sansa’s marriage to Tyrion can and is likely to be quickly annulled at some point, I’m sure Robb would be fine with Sansa being queen for now.

Also it’s kind of irrelevant because again there’s only like three people who know.

2. The Purple Wedding happens and LF kidnaps Sansa.

See also: LF’s elaborate scheme to get Winterfell to Sansa and also marry her without alerting the Lannisters until it is too late because he’s a DICK!!!

Because Sansa’s whereabouts are unknown post ASOS and “Arya” is found, the Boltons get to cash in on this so that Ramsay can be Lord in the eyes of the North. He’s the Lord and not the King because Tommen granted it to the Boltons.

So yeah Sansa’s kinda the Queen now. Or at least the lady of Winterfell. Hence Jon’s line about Winterfell belonging to Sansa. Because it does.

Note: apparently in some irl cases there has to be specific wording in legal documents saying the title can pass to female heirs. I’m operating on the North having that kind of legislation considering that if we weren’t then the Lannisters and the Boltons would be especially dumb.
